item.description:
I'm planning to hike the Glencliff Trail on Mt. Moosilauke on Satur day, July 16th.  Mt. Moosilauke is a 4,000 footer. 

------------------------

We'll ascend to the summit of Moosilauke via the Glencliff Trail to the Carriage Road to the summit.  This hike is 7.8 miles and 7 hours, 10 minutes (book time)

Be prepared for cool and potentially poor weather conditions. DO NOT WEAR COTTON OR DENIM. If you have questions about how to prepare or how to dress, ask them in advance. Come prepared to stay dry!!

Answers to FAQs

  • This is NOT a traverse, so we will NOT need to carpool to another location.
  • We will meet in the parking lot at the Glencliff trail head at 9:30am.
  • Sunset will be at  about 8:26pm.
  • The upper portion hike (summit) is *EXPOSED*
  • We will pass a cabin early on in the hike, but I have no idea what kinds of facilities are available there.  Bring plenty of water for yourself and your dog(s).
  • Headlamps are not required but strongly suggested as a safety precaution.  Always be prepared to come out in the dark if necessary.
  • We will START AND FINISH TOGETHER. If you cannot hold your speed down to match that of the group (if necessary), this is not the hike for you.
  • I am not a speedy hiker, but I do keep a steady pace.
  • If the conditions are prohibitive, I have no qualms about turning around. The mountain will be there another day.  I would like you to be around for another day too.
  • My hikes area always dog friendly, but please know the limits and abilities of your dog & bring plenty of water. 
  • I will watch the weather carefully and post weather updates during the week leading up to the hike. I rely on NOAA and MWObs for my forecasts.
  • I will provide attendees with my cell phone number in advance of the hike.
  • I leave from Concord, NH and would be willing to carpool from the Park and Ride on Stickney Ave in Concord (off Exit 14 on I-93)

 

Most of the payoff comes in the form of great views & enjoying the outdoors, so if it looks like the weather will be miserable, we may reschedule.  Please plan accordingly.

RSVP Questions are not optional - If you do not provide me with a phone number to try and contact you on the morning of the hike (if necessary), we will NOT wait for you at the trailhead.


Book time (round trip) is about  7.8 miles, 7hrs, 10 minutes. Plan on it taking about this long & possibly a little more since we intend to spend some time at the summit enjoying the view.   My climbs have been averaging a little faster than book time these days, even when stops are not taken out.

DISCLAIMER (SHAMELESSLY PLAGERIZED FROM ANOTHER MEETUP HIKER): MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN (OR EXPERIENCED OR EVEN CAUSED) IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I HAVE NOT CLIMBED THIS PEAK IN SUMMER AND HAVE DONE ALL MY RESEARCH VIA GUIDEBOOKS, INTERNET AND ADVICE FROM OTHER HIKERS, SO IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME INFORMATION IS NOT ACCURATE. I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
